page.title: 10Local sites of interest
page.content:
The parish church is the largest in Essex. It stands on one of the highest spots in the town and can be seen for many miles.
Near the church are the ruins of the castle. They are now in th grounds of the museum which has a large anthropololgical section.
The Youth Hostel is in what used to be a grain store and mill. It still has the original medieval pegged roof to look up at from in bed.
On the common is a maze. This is a turf maze with bricks to walk on. Although it is only about 20 metres across it is about a mile to walk the brick path. No one knows its origins.
